name: NumentaHTM
paper: Unsupervised Real-Time Anomaly Detection for Streaming Data.
description: The technique is based on an online sequence memory algorithm called Hierarchical Temporal Memory (HTM). HTM sequence memory consists of a layer of HTM neurons organized into a set of columns. The network accepts a stream of inputs encoded as sparse vectors. It models high-order sequences (sequences with long-term dependencies) using a composition of two separate sparse representations.
bibtex: @article{Ahmad2017UnsupervisedRA,title={Unsupervised real-time anomaly detection for streaming data},author={Subutai Ahmad and Alexander Lavin and Scott Purdy and Zuha Agha},journal={Neurocomputing},year={2017},volume={262},pages={134-147},}
